name: TheAtlantic
text: According to data from @COVID19Tracking, December began with 259,697 dead since the pandemic’s beginning. On December 23, the total was 317,513. That puts the total deaths reported so far this month at 57,683—over April’s record, writes @whet: https://t.co/EdDpCjt0m2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: Trump’s pardon of Manafort and Stone is the realization of the Founders’ worst fears, writes @RosenzweigP https://t.co/UBHxmjZbPT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The most insidious damage to American norms from Trump’s pardon extravaganza stems not from the extravaganza itself, though that is bad enough," @RosenzweigP writes:  https://t.co/SU0ssRQRm6

name: TheAtlantic
text: A few reports of allergic reactions to COVID-19 vaccines pale in comparison to the damage this disease does in a single minute, @jameshamblin reports. https://t.co/ysgcyiJ3QI

name: TheAtlantic
text: "With Manafort’s pardon, kleptocracy has successfully waited out its enemies," writes @FranklinFoer: https://t.co/ebKRnnjrqO

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @FranklinFoer: I've been writing about Manafort for years. It was painful to absorb this latest turn. But the lesson of his life is that venality always prevails in the end. I should have seen this coming... https://t.co/DZPYCfUHAo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Minks keep getting COVID-19, and as the virus spreads among mink, and between minks and humans, and between humans and humans, it can mutate, @zoeschlanger writes: https://t.co/NJ4W9Fg18K

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2019 was the deadliest year on record for hate crimes, but the record is incomplete, @AdamHSays writes. https://t.co/5B8wm7Dk4q

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Revisiting Shakespeare’s dark exploration of the dissolution of family, friendship, personality, and nation has become part of my annual rhythm," @MLabberton writes: https://t.co/X2doUauIIz

name: TheAtlantic
text: With under a month left in office, President Donald Trump is flexing his power, issuing a slew of pardons and a veto. His actions may stun, but not necessarily surprise. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/BUQG0hqijk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: “‘Lights, please.’ For half a century, it’s been one of the most significant phrases in American Christianity. A prelude to something sacred in an unlikely place: the Gospel of Luke, King James translation, as recited by Linus van Pelt.” —@CaitlinPacific
https://t.co/ZJSnRKwu1q

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @sarahzhang: "I fear mink are just the tip of the iceberg of what could be coming." — @zoeschlanger on the possibility that animals could be a coronavirus reservoir that keeps reseeding outbreaks in the future 

https://t.co/Akcxpz73hB

text: "The most insidious damage to American norms from Trump’s pardon extravaganza stems not from the extravaganza itself, though that is bad enough," @RosenzweigP writes:  https://t.co/3Jqef3fDyY

name: TheAtlantic
text: According to data from @COVID19Tracking, December began with 259,697 dead since the pandemic’s beginning. On December 23, the total was 317,513. That puts the total deaths reported so far this month at 57,683—over April’s record, writes @whet. https://t.co/H5wJNFv4Sj

name: TheAtlantic
text: What drives writers to drink? James Parker seeks the answer to an ancient riddle in the eloquent benders of Herman Mankiewicz and Dylan Thomas. https://t.co/8u6h5nMHsM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Britain appeared willing to make significant concessions to the EU to protect a relatively minor industry: fish. Yet, as @TomMcTague notes, national life has to be about more than simple calculations of GDP. https://t.co/tZHLdZalLX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @FranklinFoer: For Jared Kushner, his dad’s pardon is the ultimate trophy. His whole existence has been about removing the stain of criminality from the family. I wrote about his pathological obsequiousness toward father figures last summer. https://t.co/Gsj11uudXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Last night, President Trump pardoned Paul Manafort, his former campaign chair, after convictions for financial fraud and other crimes. In March 2018, Franklin Foer unpacked the details of how Manafort's corruption influenced Washington:  https://t.co/xEZfkElUcZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Yesterday, Trump pardoned Charles Kushner, the father of his son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Earlier this year, Franklin Foer explored how a lifetime with Charles helped turn Jared into Trump’s most dangerous enabler. https://t.co/MZtT3IY260

name: TheAtlantic
text: Long-term-care residents are counting down the last lonely days before they can finally receive a vaccine, @elainejgodfrey reports: https://t.co/7gTrQFnLZJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Transcendent Kingdom," “Uncanny Valley,” “A Burning,” and more: The Atlantic's writers and editors choose their favorite books of the year. https://t.co/Gl0269BRRt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: "Isn’t one of Brexit’s central points that national life is about more than gross domestic product?"

Read @TomMcTague in @TheAtlantic on Brexit, and the compromises Britain made https://t.co/VdCRzSrOe7

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Kids’ presents are more contingent on their families’ resources than their own behavior—but the Santa myth says the opposite." @JessicaCalarco argues that Santa teaches kids a bad lesson about meritocracy: https://t.co/yjccqQCjMp

name: TheAtlantic
text: “A Charlie Brown Christmas” is “Waiting for Godot,” brought to you by Coca-Cola. @CaitlinPacific reflects on the 1965 "Peanuts" special. https://t.co/PHVNgY8wvW
